io.spine.server.bus

Class Bus<T extends com.google.protobuf.Message,E extends io.spine.core.MessageEnvelope<?,T,?>,C extends io.spine.type.MessageClass,D extends MessageDispatcher<C,E,?>>

  • java.lang.Object
    • io.spine.server.bus.Bus<T,E,C,D>
  • Type Parameters:
    T - the type of outer objects (containing messages of interest) that are posted the bus
    E - the type of envelopes for outer objects used by this bus
    C - the type of message class
    D - the type of dispatches used by this bus
    All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.lang.AutoCloseable
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    CommandBus, MulticastBus

    public abstract class Bus<T extends com.google.protobuf.Message,E extends io.spine.core.MessageEnvelope<?,T,?>,C extends io.spine.type.MessageClass,D extends MessageDispatcher<C,E,?>>
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.lang.AutoCloseable
    Abstract base for buses.

      • post

        public final void post(java.lang.Iterable<T> messages,
                       io.grpc.stub.StreamObserver<io.spine.core.Ack> observer)
        Posts the given messages to the bus.

        The observer serves to notify the consumer about the result of the call. The StreamObserver.onNext() is called for each message posted to the bus.

        In case the message is accepted by the bus, Ack with the OK status is passed to the observer.

        If the message cannot be sent due to some issues, a corresponding Error status is passed in Ack instance.

        Depending on the underlying MessageDispatcher, a message which causes a business Rejection may result ether a Rejection status or an OK status Ack instance. Usually, the Rejection status may only pop up if the MessageDispatcher processes the message sequentially and throws the rejection (wrapped in a the ThrowableMessages) instead of handling them. Otherwise, the OK status should be expected.

        Note that StreamObserver.onError() is never called for the passed observer, since errors are propagated as statuses of Ack response.

        Parameters:
        messages - the messages to post
        observer - the observer to receive outcome of the operation

      • close

        public void close()
           throws java.lang.Exception
        Closes the filters of this bus and unregisters all the dispatchers.
        Specified by:

      • createFilterChain

        protected abstract java.util.Deque<BusFilter<E>> createFilterChain()
        Creates a Deque of the custom bus filters for the current instance of Bus.

        This method should be invoked only once when initializing the filter chain of this bus.

        Returns:
        a deque of the bus custom filters

      • dispatch

        protected abstract void dispatch(E envelope)
        Passes the given envelope for dispatching.

        Finds and invokes the MessageDispatcher(s) for the given message.

        This method assumes that the given message has passed the filtering.

        See Also:
        for the public API
